How to live as your own island, your own: Let the teaching be your island and your refuge, with no other refuge.
Meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
Meditate observing an aspect of mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
Meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
The noble duties of a wheel-turning mona: Having principle as your flag, banner, and authority
Provide just protection and security for your court, troops, aristocrats, vassals, brahmins and householders, people of town and country, ascetics and brahmins, beasts and birds
Do not let injustice prevail in the realm
Pay money to the penniless in the realm
From time to time, go up to ascetics and brahmins in the realm who avoid intoxication and negligence, are settled in patience and gentleness, and who tame, calm, and extinguish themselves

Ask them what is skillful, what is unskillful, what is blameworthy, what is blameless, what should be cultivated, what should not be cultivated, doing what leads to lasting harm and suffering, and doing what leads to lasting welfare and happiness
Having heard them, reject what is unskillful and undertake and follow what is skillful.
The journey of the wheel-treasure [dn26:: The wheel-treasure appeared to the king on a fifteenth day sabbath
The king besprinkled the wheel-treasure with a ceremonial vase and it rolled towards the east
The king followed the wheel-treasure with his army of four divisions and stayed wherever it stopped
The opposing rulers of the eastern quarter became his vassals
The wheel-treasure plunged into the southern ocean and emerged again, then rolled towards the west
The opposing rulers of the western quarter became his vassals
The wheel-treasure plunged into the northern ocean and emerged again, then rolled towards the north
The opposing rulers of the northern quarter became his vassals
The wheel-treasure returned to the royal capital and stood still by the gate to the royal compound at the High Court, illuminating the royal compound.
The instructions of the wheel-turning mo: Maintain the current level of taxation.
The establishment of subsequent wheel-tu: A wheel-turning monarch was established in exactly the same way
This happened for a second time, and a third, a fourth, a fifth, a sixth, and a seventh time
After many years, the seventh wheel-turning monarch went forth, handing the realm over to the crown prince
Seven days later the heavenly wheel-treasure vanished
The consequences of not implementing the: The newly anointed aristocrat king was informed that the heavenly wheel-treasure had vanished
The king governed the country according to his own ideas
The nations did not prosper like before
The ministers and counselors gathered and advised the king to ask about the noble duties of a wheel-turning monarch.
The noble duties of a wheel-turning mona: Pay money to the penniless in the realm
The consequences of not paying money to: Harsh speech and talking nonsense became widespread
Desire and ill will became widespread
Illicit desire, immoral greed, and wrong thoughts became widespread
Lack of due respect for mother and father, ascetics and brahmins, and failure to honor the elders in the family became widespread
The decline of lifespan and beauty (a ca: People who lived for 80,000 years had children who lived for 40,000 years
People who lived for 40,000 years had children who lived for 20,000 years
People who lived for 20,000 years had children who lived for 10,000 years
People who lived for 10,000 years had children who lived for 5,000 years
People who lived for 5,000 years had some children who lived for 2,500 years, while others lived for 2,000 years
People who lived for 2,500 years had children who lived for 1,000 years
People who lived for 1,000 years had children who lived for 500 years
People who lived for 500 years had some children who lived for 250 years, while others lived for 200 years
People who lived for 250 years had children who lived for 100 years.
The ten ways of doing skillful deeds and: The ten ways of doing skillful deeds will totally disappear
The ten ways of doing unskillful deeds will explode in popularity
The people who will not be respected [dn: anyone who disrespects mother and father
anyone who disrespects ascetics and brahmins
anyone who fails to honor the elders in the family
The skillful things that the beings unde: give up illicit desire, immoral greed, and wrong thoughts
pay due respect to mother and father, ascetics and brahmins, honoring the elders in our families
The lifespan and beauty growth of the be: Undertaking the skillful thing of refraining from killing living creatures
Children who live for twenty years
Children who live for forty years
Children who live for eighty years
Children who live for a hundred and sixty years
Children who live for three hundred and twenty years
Children who live for six hundred and forty years
The age at which girls will be marriagea: Among the people who live for 80,000 years, girls will be marriageable at five hundred.
The description of India during the time: Villages, towns, and capital cities will be no more than a chicken’s flight apart
The land will be as crowded as hell, just full of people, like a thicket of rushes or reeds
There will be 84,000 cities in India, with the royal capital of Ketumati foremost
The seven treasures possessed by King Sa: The counselor as the seventh treasure
The achievements of King Saṅkha [dn26:23: His dominion will extend to all four sides
He will achieve stability in the country
He will possess the seven treasures
He will have over a thousand sons who are valiant and heroic
He will crush the armies of his enemies
After conquering this land girt by sea, he will reign by principle, without rod or sword.
The description of the Buddha Metteyya [: Supreme guide for those who wish to train
The Dhamma and spiritual practice of the: He will teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased
He will reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure
The actions of King Saṅkha [dn26:25.0]: He will have the sacrificial post that had been built by King Mahāpanāda raised up
After staying there, he will give it away to ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, travelers, and beggars
Having shaved off his hair and beard and dressed in ocher robes, he will go forth from the lay life to homelessness in the Buddha Metteyya’s presence
Soon after going forth, living withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, he will realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life
He will live having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness
The way a mendicant lives as their own i: They meditate by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world
They meditate observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world
They meditate observing an aspect of mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world
They meditate observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world
The basis of psychic power for a mendica: The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development, and active effort
The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort
The qualities of beauty for a mendicant: Seeing danger in the slightest fault
The absorptions and happiness for a mend: They enter and remain in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected
As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption
They enter and remain in the third absorption
They enter and remain in the fourth absorption
The qualities of wealth for a mendicant: Spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth
Spreading a heart full of compassion to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth
Spreading a heart full of rejoicing to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth
Spreading a heart full of equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth
The power of a mendicant [dn26:28.0]: Realizing the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
Living having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements
